update.description:
Link now publishes timestamped velocity data used by the imu sensor for calculating accelerations
Tested the imu sensor with the BDI walking controller and the robot seems to walk fine

Fix for issue #600

Update: Fix imu frame after merge
update.title: Updated imu sensor  to subscribe to timestamped link data

I cannot reproduce the failures. I ran it in Jenkins and [the report](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64/65/testReport/?) shows that all tests pass. 

I also did gz_build_test, and ran each test individually, they all passed.

I cannot reproduce the failures. I ran it in Jenkins and the report shows that all tests pass.

I also did gz_build_test, and ran each test individually, they all passed.

content.raw: As issue #623 is now resolved,  Imu data are now being published at ~1k Hz. I was then able to test this patch with AtlasSimInterface and the keyboard teleop tool, and the robot walked fine.
content.html: As issue #623 is now resolved, Imu data are now being published at ~1k Hz. I was then able to test this patch with AtlasSimInterface and the keyboard teleop tool, and the robot walked fine.

content.raw:
Is a list needed? We could have a fixed two element array and an index. `OnLinkData` could always write into `array[index]`.  

`UpdateImpl` will toggle `index` at the start in the mutex lock, and read from the previous value of index.
content.html:
Is a list needed? We could have a fixed two element array and an index. OnLinkData could always write into array[index].

UpdateImpl will toggle index at the start in the mutex lock, and read from the previous value of index.
